About

What I Do

I take designs for websites and web apps and bring them to life using foundational programming tools and concepts that allow everyone to connect with your or your client's services.

After spending the better part of a decade problem solving logistical challenges, client relationships, and process/team workflows as a project manager I transitioned from managing the work to doing the work.

I've been excited and grateful to have the privilege to make something with my own two hands every day since — even when that something is made of bits of data instead of metal or wood.

Projects

Photographer Portfolio Showcase

Summary

Each of the projects highlighted below belong to a larger soon-to-be-released professional website that I'm building for a photographer client. With their permission I've linked to a demo version of that website in order to showcase several key projects it contains.

The client's goal is to showcase their work online while also offering people who visit the website the ability to purchase any of the photos presented in the website's photo galleries.

Homepage

Homepage

Summary

Mobile responsive homepage that reinforces the site's ultimate function as an online photography portfolio via strong imagery throughout each section of the page and provides multiple routes to the primary user flow: viewing a photo in a gallery and adding it to a user's cart.

A partial-width opacity layer is applied to several background images in order to improve text legibility without sacrificing the clarity of the image's focal content.

Languages Used

  • HTML
  • CSS (SASS)
  • Javascript

View Project

Project Demo GitHub Repo

Photo Gallery

Photo Gallery

Summary

Category-based photo gallery that offers users the ability to filter photos via one or more photo tags.

Clicking a photo opens it in a full-screen lightbox window to provide users a larger view of the image, an alternative gallery navigator in the form of an image-preview filmstrip, and a CTA button for purchasing the lightbox's current featured image.

Languages Used

  • HTML
  • CSS (SASS)
  • Javascript

View Project

Project Demo GitHub Repo

Shopping Cart

Shopping Cart

Summary

Displays all items present in a user's cart as well as each individual item cost and the total cart cost with a CTA to proceed with checkout.

Print size, print finish and quantity selections for each item can be modified and saved. Upon saving updated item selections the cart page automatically refreshes to display the most current cart data.

This demo makes use of the browser's built in localStorage property to store and retrieve user cart data.

Languages Used

  • HTML
  • CSS (SASS)
  • Javascript

View Project

Project Demo GitHub Repo

Contact Form

Contact Form

Summary

Dedicated contact page that provides users a way to send their questions and comments directly to the website owner.

Each field is required and prompts the user to complete or correct any missing or incomplete fields. Form submission is currently powered via the service FormSubmit which functions as a form endpoint to facilitate emailing the contact submission to the site owner.

The grumpy bird background image may or may not deter spam. In the event it fails to do so the FormSubmit service requires users to pass a basic reCAPTCHA test before returning a successful submission page.

Languages Used

  • HTML
  • CSS (SASS)
  • Javascript

View Project

Project Demo GitHub Repo
